column4: hello, i am trying to send an email using sendmail to my gmail account, but the email never gets there.
gmail is probably blocking you as you are on a home connection
most ISP's will block mail servers running on home connections
how can I test if it's a sendmail error or a gmail error?
it won't be a gmail error....if there was a gmail error, more people would be complaining that gmail is failing
what I mean is, how can I know if gmail is blocking the email or if the email is not sent at all
just look in the mailq if the mail is still there or not
yep, both there. says Sender address rejected
well how can I know who rejected them then :)
it's not your ISP - it's gmail, you are on a home connection ( I assume ) most mail services will reject home connections running mail servers
it's not in the queue anymore
however it's not in my spam/inbox either :s
so it's probably going to the bounce address you setup
